Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the difficulty Republicans have had in beating incumbent Democratic senators.
Understate: The claim may understate the number of times Republicans have beaten incumbent Democratic senators in the past 35 years.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the statement that Republicans have not beaten more than two incumbents since 1980.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that beating incumbent Democratic senators is the only measure of success for Republican Senate candidates.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the difficulty Republicans have had in beating incumbent Democratic senators, such as changing demographics or political climate.
